extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, demonstrating an excessive attachment to worldly pleasures that neglects the call to temperance?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: to an excessive preoccupation with worldly pleasures that distracts from cultivating a spirit of temperance
with worldly pleasures that distracts from cultivating a spirit of temperance
from cultivating a spirit of temperance
gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking, leading to an excessive preoccupation with worldly pleasures that distracts from cultivating a spirit of temperance?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in discussing others ' faults or private affairs
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' faults or private affairs, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing others' private affairs, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: in sharing criticisms or private details about acquaintances
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing criticisms or private details about acquaintances, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

impiety.question: Did you engage in work on a Sunday, even though it could have been avoided?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).
